page.title: 02The village of Middlezoy
page.content: The village of Middlezoy, together with the outlying hamlets of Thorngrove and Greylake consists of some 206 dwellings and has a population of 561. There are 114 children under 18, 48 of whom attend the village primary school, and a retired population of 109. Middlezoy, once totally involved in farming, still has 12 working farms within the village, but these now only provide minimal employment. The majority of workers in the village commute to Bridgwater or Taunton areas, although there are several self-employed within the village. The village has one public house, one shop and post office combined, one primary school, a Church of England church, a Methodist chapel and a village hall.
